locations.name: Port Moresby Nature Park
locations.address: Goro Kaeaga Road, University, Port Moresby
locations.description: A lush 30-acre wildlife sanctuary featuring over 550 native animals, including tree kangaroos and cassowaries.

locations.name: Bomana War Cemetery
locations.description: The largest war cemetery in the Pacific, containing 3,824 Commonwealth graves from World War II.

locations.name: National Museum & Art Gallery
locations.description: Established in 1975, this museum houses over 30,000 artifacts, showcasing Papua New Guinea’s rich cultural heritage.

locations.name: Ela Beach
locations.description: A scenic beachfront area perfect for relaxation, swimming, and local events with stunning ocean views.

locations.name: Varirata National Park
locations.description: A breathtaking 1,000-hectare nature reserve offering hiking trails, panoramic views, and diverse wildlife.

locations.name: Saint Mary’s Catholic Cathedral
locations.description: A striking Catholic cathedral known for its blue-and-white exterior, serving as the headquarters of the Archdiocese of Port Moresby.

locations.name: National Orchid Garden
locations.address: Hubert Murray Highway, 14 Mile, Port Moresby
locations.description: A stunning botanical garden showcasing hundreds of hybrid and native orchids.

locations.name: Parliament House of Papua New Guinea
locations.description: The official seat of Papua New Guinea’s National Parliament, opened by Prince Charles in 1984.
